path.title: Creatorise
path.info:
This project is a static mock website for my company Creatorise.
It were used as my final exam in the courseㅤWeb Development One;ㅤthis course regards pure Front-End development;ㅤHTMLㅤandㅤCSSㅤwith the most basic of JavaScript, taken at Kattegattgymnasiet, Halmstad.
It is static webpages where information cannot be updated by any user.

path.title: Firebook
path.info:
Firebook, is a fullㅤCRUDㅤwebapplication with ㅤauthenticationㅤandㅤauthoritisationㅤutalizing Google's BaaS(Backend-as-a-Service);Firebase, as well as its corresponding DaaSㅤㅤ(Database-as-a-Service);ㅤㅤFireStoreㅤ and ultilizing its FireStore Rules. Firestore automaticly serialize data for security.
This firebase project were interiely applied to Front-EndㅤJavaScript.ㅤ
As this is my Exam Thesis, I've written a full report about this project with the title INSERT HERE -arative analys between PHP and Firebase

path.title: PHP-Books
path.info:
PHP-Books is the project I made for my half-course exam, made in PHP for the course Webserver Development One at Kattegattgymnasiet.
It contains fullㅤCRUDㅤㅤwithㅤㅤauthoritizationㅤㅤandㅤauthenticationㅤ,ㅤutilizing server sessions to keep tab on logged in users.

path.title: CoffeBooks
path.info:
CoffeBooks is my final course exam project forㅤWeb Server Development Oneㅤat Kattegattgymnasiet.
It has a backend made inㅤNode.JSㅤmostly built as a set of API's, and a frontend in standardㅤJavaScriptㅤ which was developed after the backend was made.
The Node.JS project is connected to aㅤMongoDBㅤcluster for data storage, utilizing fullㅤCRUDㅤandㅤauthentication as well asㅤauthoritizationㅤfor a number of requests. Inputfileds get serialized for added security and sensitive user data is handled with bcrypt.
